language for apis that's the way they describe themselves and it was created
by Facebook to solve Facebook scale problems now I I like to make that emphasis as part of the talks they give
about graphql because it's important to understand that graphql isn't going to be right for every project that you
build yes there are a lot of use cases that graphql will be suited for but there are a lot of use cases that it's
not going to be suited for so use it as a opportunity to learn something that can be a new tool in your toolbox but
not the only tool in your toolbox when it comes to building apis now graphql is kind of an opposite
direction to the way that we would design an API compared to rest graphql very much puts the onus of
responsibility to the client in that they have a lot more of the power about what data that they want and how they're
going to get that the server defines the data that's still available like the server still has to present a data
schema that a graphical client can work with but the client is the one that then is able to select out of that what they
want to achieve and what data that they need now the reason this is a like this
can be advantageous is that it gives you an ability to avoid a common problem with rest and that is overfetching of
data let's say that you have a rest endpoint where you uh where it will return like 15 fields for a single
object model but for this display you really only need two or three natural us here in um in Australia with
our you know super fast broadband internet and now 5G access so we can pull that down in no times but think about people that have
poor internet connections someone that maybe doesn't live in Melbourne you know they're they're like two kilometers
outside of the CBD um or someone that their only access is via a mobile device in maybe a
developing Nation Africa or South America or somewhere like that you don't want to be sending them
megabytes worth of data payloads if they don't need it because you really only needed kilobytes in that message so
that's something that graphql can address in a slightly easy design than you can with rest
um it it also but it also has its own problems that uh graphical can introduce uh we'll show I'll show it off in a demo
